Description: The fire in Mogo cut all communication in the region. I heard nothing from my family there for 25 hours.
I danced while waiting to hear from my family.
State of Disaster declared in Victoria with bushfire conditions expected to deteriorate.
We ordered Cambridge masks to protect against bushfire smoke.
I was nervous about smoke inhalation and paid for Ubers to the offsite to avoid asthma problems.
We are monitoring air quality before leaving the house.
Canberra and NSW cop massive hailstorms. Victoria suffers hailstorms, thunderstorms, and flash flooding.

Event: First COVID-19 case reported in Australia
Description: It's here!
This was lovely.
This was kinda brutal.
SVG Essentials & Animation, v2 by Sarah Drasner.
A train derailed in Wallan, killing 2 people.
The train derailment on the line I was supposed to take that weekend to Sydney meant I needed to replace my train ticket with a last-minute plane ticket.
2-day conference interstate. People were flying in with cases at this time.

Event: First Covid death reported in Australia
Description: A 78-year-old Perth man, who was one of the passengers from the Diamond Princess.
Panic buying led to shortages in stores.

Event: We all learn how to wash our hands
Description: See also: TikTok hand washing dance. See also: hand washing meme.

Event: Culture Amp starts working from home
Description: A level playing field.

Event: WHO officially declares COVID-19 a pandemic
Description: We stop talking about the novel coronavirus and start talking about the pandemic.

Event: Tom Hanks and his wife Rita Wilson test positive
Description: Isolated in Gold Coast hospital.
Who knew there'd be so few trips after this?

Event: Coles imposes 2-item limit on panic shoppers
Description: The purchase of mince, pasta, flour, dry rice, paper towels, paper tissues and hand sanitisers is limited to 2 items per customer. Toilet paper remains limited to 1 pack per customer.
Victoria declares state of emergency.
I felt so much relief at the ability to order food online again.
Closed the borders to all non-residents.

Event: Ruby Princess cruise ship docked in Sydney
Description: Celebrity Solstice contributed 11 cases. Eventually 440 passengers on Ruby Princess tested positive.
Nation-wide social distancing. Indoor gatherings of fewer than 100 people are still allowed.

Event: Dan Andrews says we shouldn't get on the beers
Description: “You won’t be able to go to the pub because the pub is shut,” said Premier Dan Andrews. “That doesn’t mean you can have all your mates around to [your] home and get on the beers, that’s not appropriate.”
From midday, 23 March, all pubs, clubs, restaurants, cinemas and indoor sporting venues across the country shut down.

For Victoria. Limit your day to day activities outside your home. If you don’t need to do it, don’t do it. If you have to go outside, keep a full arm-span (about 1.5 metres) between yourself and other people.

Event: Finished one of Shirley Wu's D3 courses

Description: $70 billion to pay employers up to $1500 a fortnight per employee.
Border towns have exceptions.
8 cases reported, later linked to 90 cases.

Event: NSW eases restrictions on public gatherings

Description: I took a trip to the Chemist to get a flu shot so I couldn't catch Covid and the flu at the same time.
This was such a fail.

Event: Rio Tinto destroys historic Aboriginal site
Description: 46,000-year-old Juukan Gorge cave in the Hammersley Ranges, WA, was destroyed.
Black Lives Matter. Several protests followed in Australia around social issues faced by Indigenous Australians, including Aboriginal deaths in custody.
This Medium article captured my first 30 days of a 100-day project.
A night duty manager and 5 security guards at Melbourne quarantine hotels tested positive leading to second wave in Melbourne.
~8% of our global team.
I couldn't go anywhere, but it was lovely.
Working From Home this much requires more pants.

Event: High Court quashes George Pell convictions
Description: “… the evidence did not establish guilt to the requisite standard of proof”

Event: Finished second of Shirley Wu's D3 courses
Description: This is a great course.

Event: Finished third of Shirley Wu's D3 courses
Description: I want to visualise things!
I published Observable notebooks daily.
People literally fighting over toilet paper.
Up to 20 people in your home or in a public place. Restaurants, cafes and pubs can have up to 20 customers dine in, and businesses such as beauty therapists can see clients again.
Visited family in Melbourne for birthday celebrations.
I had dinner at a friend's house. It was strange figuring out how to interact and social distance indoors.
Households can only have five visitors.
I had managed 84 days of consistent physio.
Normal life resumes over there.
Not my area. 10 different Melbourne postcodes.

Event: Judicial Inquiry Into Hotel Quarantine Program

Description: Further birthday celebrations.

Event: 2 more hotspot post codes locked down
Description: Friends are back in lockdown.
Only allowed to leave the house for four reasons: shopping for food and essential items, care and caregiving, daily exercise, and work. This is when we should have fled to the country.

Event: Victorian and NSW interstate border closed
Description: The border closed for the first time since the 1918–19 Spanish flu pandemic.

Event: SA imposes hard border closure to Victorians
Description: Throws border towns into chaos. My family can't do their grocery shopping.

Event: I officially resigned from my role
Description: This is one of the bigger risks I've ever taken.
At 11.59pm, masks became mandatory. A fine of A$200 will apply to those not complying. 3 days notice was given for people to buy masks.
I had a minor cough. Did drive through test.
That was a good SMS to read.
Oof. That was hard work!
Curfew between 8pm and 5am. 5km travel restriction. Reduced business. Only one hour of exercise.
Victoria declares state of disaster.

Event: Six year anniversary with my partner
Description: We did nothing special.
Iso birthdays involve lots of delivered food.

Event: My final day at Culture Amp
Description: People were so nice.

Event: Social bubbles in First Step for reopening
Description: Those living alone or single parents allowed to have one other person in their home. Playgrounds reopened. A reduction of the curfew by an hour.
Within 3 days, upwards of 450 whales were beached.

Event: Released significant changes to Typey Type
Description: I redesigned Typey Type for Stenographers, added new lessons, added a metronome, and made a bunch of fixes.

Event: Restrictions starting to ease and curfew ended
Description: Public gathering limits increased up to 5 people from 2 households outdoors for social interaction.

Event: Saw a friend at the park
Description: First non-stranger I've seen outside my house in 12 weeks.
This was a big deal for many people.

Event: Trip to hospital emergency department (not related to Covid)
Description: We're ok. 4 hours 51 minutes was the longest I'd been outside my apartment in 14 weeks.

Event: “Get on the Beers (featuring Dan Andrews)” remix goes viral
Description: Played at the Wine Machine festival in Swan Valley, WA, the viral remix by Mashd N Kutcher was officially release 26 Oct 2020.
Two-hour time limit for exercise and socialising was lifted. Hairdressers allowed to open. Many allied health services allowed to have face-to-face services.
First time leaving my 5km bubble in 15 weeks (except for the hospital trip).
Prospect of employment!
Postal voting was so easy.

Event: News of lockdown ending in 2 days
Description: I cried.

Event: Donut Day shows 0 cases and 0 deaths in Vic
Description: Victorians celebrate by buying donuts in droves.

Event: Dan Andrews confirms we can get on the beers
Description: “Can I confirm you are saying we can finally get on the beers?” a reporter asked at the presser. “I don’t know that I’ll be drinking a beer tonight,” replies Premier Dan Andrews. “I might go a little higher up the shelf.”

Event: People no longer require a reason to leave home
Description: All retail, restaurants, hotels, cafes and bars allowed to open with capacity limits. Beauty, personal services and tattooing reopened, outdoor community and non-contact sport recommences. A maximum of 10 people allowed to attend weddings. A maximum of 20 mourners allowed to attend funerals. Faith and religious gatherings allowed to resume.
First time since June.
Gyms and fitness studios opened, capacity limits for restaurants, hotels, cafes and bars increased, gathering limits for faith and religious gatherings increased, and indoor pools opened.

Event: Ring of Steel around Melbourne opened
Description: Finally allowed to leave the city.

Event: Saw out of Melbourne family for the first time in six months
Description: Left the city! It was glorious.
Australia Post's public endorsement of Traditional Place name addressing came during NAIDOC week.
I didn't need a puffer at this time.

Event: Breakfast with a friend at a favourite cafe
Description: Potentially the last time we'll be here for years!
What a concept! Finally met our friends' new twins.

Event: South Australia locks down after outbreak
Ate out at a restaurant for dinner
Description: First time since… I can remember.

Event: Saw Mum for the first time since January
Description: Such a moment.
Successful tracing.

Event: NSW opens its borders to Victoria
Description: Progress!

Event: We moved out of Melbourne to regional Victoria
Description: Fleeeeeeeee!

Event: Queensland opens its borders to Victoria
Description: Sunshine awaits!
The interest rate on Treasury notes went negative for the first time. The Australian government was paid to borrow money.
Spent time with one part of the family in outback Victoria.
The national COVID-19 hotspot was declared because of the outbreak linked to 28 cases, later linked to 83 cases.

Event: WA closes its border to NSW again
Description: The hard border closure prohibits travel from anywhere in NSW to WA without an exemption.
Spent time with another part of the family in regional Victoria.

Event: Applied for and received Queensland Border Pass
Description: Phew! There was not a lot of wriggle room for this.
A small Christmas celebration.
We started a 4-day drive to move to Queensland.
We made it!

Event: Victoria ended 61-day streak of no cases
Description: There were 3 community cases.
